page.title: 01East of Benmore Lodge
page.content:
Most of the area east of Benmore Lodge is covered by young coniferous trees planted by the Forestry Commission. In square 3211, there are several buildings: the Lodge, which is in the process of being built (the last one having been knocked down several years ago), a bothy, the keepers cottage, which is the only inhabited house and various outbuildings.
The keeper and his family live at Benmore Lodge all the time. His job is to look after the wildlife and sport on Benmore Estate. This involves culling the deer to keep the numbers at the size which the ground can support, grouse-shooting (although there are only a few birds on the estate), fishing and keeping the parks and buildings in order.
